abstract: The French oil giant Total said Monday that it was acquiring a 25 percent stake in tens of thousands of acres of natural gas fields in Texas controlled by Chesapeake Energy in a joint venture deal valued at $2.25 billion.
snippet: The French oil giant Total said Monday that it was acquiring a 25 percent stake in tens of thousands of acres of natural gas fields in Texas controlled by Chesapeake Energy in a joint venture deal valued at $2.25 billion.
lead_paragraph: The French oil giant Total said Monday that it was acquiring a 25 percent stake in tens of thousands of acres of natural gas fields in Texas controlled by Chesapeake Energy in a joint venture deal valued at $2.25 billion.

headline.main: Total Joins Chesapeake in Gas Joint Venture
